dr_report_evaluation_qa.answer: As EV sales growth slows, automakers are emphasizing after-sales service quality, with strong warranties and customer support as key differentiators. A survey revealed that 75% of global consumers prioritize warranties when purchasing vehicles, prompting EV brands like VinFast to offer 10-year comprehensive warranties, including battery coverage, to build trust with hesitant buyers.

EV companies are enhancing customer service by incorporating software updates as part of aftersales services, with VinFast using over-the-air updates to add features like entertainment apps to existing vehicles. Additionally, VinFast has partnered to secure access to over 90,000 charging stations in North America, addressing range anxiety and improving convenience for customers.

In the EV sector, companies are adopting future-oriented aftersales strategies like remote diagnostics and predictive maintenance to proactively address issues and offer personalized services. While technology plays a crucial role, executives emphasize that exceptional customer care, such as quick roadside assistance and attentive service staff, is vital for fostering customer loyalty and positive word-of-mouth during the shift to electric mobility.
